description.narrative: This project mainly contributes to results within Good governance. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020

Transparency International Sri Lanka (TISL) is a National Chapter of Tranparency Internaiton, the leading global movement against corruption. The main purpose is to contribute to increase understanding of corruption, strengthen anti-corruption structures and processes and to appreciate upholding of integrity. TISL has identified that lack of political will of the government to strengthen transparent and accountable standards. This has resulted in a negative impact on development of the country, and also affected the reconciliation process. Envisioning a nation that upholds integrity, TISL’s goal is to support the collective effort to eradicate corruption in order to build a future Sri Lanka which is equitable, peaceful and just. Promoting and educating citizen on existing and new laws and mediating between duty bearer and right holder has contributed to creating a space to promote transparentcy and accountability of people in positions of power. The efforts also support increaseing women’s political participation while reinforcing political culture that supports women political actors and gender sensitive policies. TISL actively engages in supporting citizen and encouraging people’s participation at district and local level and influence decisions making processes. The efforts contribute to achieving democratization and social economic justice processes that address unfair structures and hinder democratic processes. TISL’s legal advice cenre provides services to both victims and witnesses of corruption and mediate with State institutions. Thematic areas Gender equality, Democracy and Conflict and justice
